title: Works ok
comment: Good but seems to crash when up dating on 3g.  Loads of crashes also when playing music.  Please fix.

title: Erroneously suggests bad password when using self-signed SSL certificate
comment: I have a fresh new ampache server set up as part of ownCloud.  To be safe, I restrict all connetions to https.  I can connect just fine via Tomahawk in Ubuntu.  However, the Ampache Provider plugin for JustPlayer suggest that I am using a bad password or username.  I tried a few more times, copying and pasting the password, but it continues to suggest I'm using a bad username or password.  Tellingly, it also makes this suggestion if the URL is wrong.  For  example, on one attempt, I input https://domainname/owncloud/remote.pho/ampache vs. https://domainname/owncloud/remote.php/ampache, and it tells me the username and password may be wrong.  Obviously, this a problem with exception handling.   I suspect, but have not yet confirmed, that the problem is due to the self-signed certificate.  Other applications will ask me if I want to make an exception.   However,  this plugin just suggest bad username/password....regardless of what the actual exception is...apparently.

title: Great stuff
comment: Just setup ampache on my raspberry pi. Thanks!

title: Great free ampache plugin
comment: Thanks for offering this wonderful ampache plugin for "JUST PLAYER". I love the idea of sharing software without any charges. @Developer: Thank you!

title: Works pretty good
comment: Works quite well and fast. Although justPlayer integration is little buggy.

title: Doesn't work
comment: What a bunch of crap. Even pressing 'check' to verify an install does nothing.

title: Please fix!
comment: This is just great. doesn't play long mp3's though.

title: Won't login
comment: I can login on webpage just fine but when I put the same credentials in this app I keep getting an acl error.

title: Confused
comment: Ive connected this up and subvert but I can't get out of the config page?

title: Amazing
comment: This player works really well with a big collection served by ampache. I really like the fact that it works offline with some songs cached.  Feature request: to have multiple ampache backends.  Do you have a flattr account?

title: Worked for me
comment: Just got done sync'ing 24971 songs. 156GBs of music in the palm of my hand again. Thanks!  Atrix - CM7

title: Doesn't work with large catalogs
comment: I have over 20,000 songs and this won't sync on my Droid Razr Maxx, AOS 2.3.6. Works great when I reduce the catalog size to a couple thousand.

title: Works great
comment: Never had a problem with any of my ~100gb catalogs. Keep it up!

title: Problems
comment: Seems like a good app, only like others have mentioned, does not sync large catalogs.  when this is fixed it will prob. be a really good app.

title: Well....
comment: Seems like every other update breaks something for me. Now it hangs on sync with my large catalogs. Unusable!

title: Works great.
comment: Thank you for this very useful plugin and player!

title: Brilliant Ampache plugin
comment: Just seems to work for me, 14000 tracks running as if local!

title: Fixed!
comment: Connection to port 8080 fixed. Thanks! Works wonderfully again.
Love it. Works great on my Desire with Ampache 3.5. Thanks for the app!
